urls.title: Consultation to safeguard water supplies and protect environment
urls.description: Seven additional water company areas may need to adopt the highest level of water-saving measures

domain.name: Interests and Hobbies Vertical

tweets.text:
Climate change, population growth and drought all put pressure on #water supplies üíß

We're launching a consultation on our updated map of the areas of the country where this pressure could be greatest.

Help us safeguard our future water supplies: https://t.co/QiNHGViNau https://t.co/QVOR9eKIlC

As as part of the programme of recovery to last month‚Äôs #floods, #TeamEA and our partners have started work to repair an embankment on the River Alt @LuntMeadows Nature Reserve and flood storage area.

urls.title: Anthony urges residents to help save Cambridgeshire‚Äôs waterways
urls.description: Anthony Browne, MP for South Cambridgeshire, is asking residents to engage with a new consultation from the Environment Agency to ensure Cambridge is classed as an area of ‚Äúwater stress‚Äù

tweets.text:
On @BBCCambs soon to discuss a new consultation from @EnvAgency on methodology classifying Cambridgeshire as an area of water stress.

We face serious problems with water shortages, impacting valuable natural resources such as chalk streams. More info üëá
https://t.co/ZfVOs9I2Qq
@EnvAgency has launched it's charm offensive ahead of its planning application for a 300-metre dam paid for by a 400 acre quarry.   Not needed, not wanted, worst option:   https://t.co/ABcnLPlDuf

@MoorlandMonitor @stwater @EnvAgency @PeakChief @TimBirchWild @SheffieldGreens @ShefHallamLab @WarOnWildlife MM & Calderdale Monitors The 2 Original educational groups, excellent work! Highlighting countryside horrors. NO normal citizens want this. EXPOSED

@MoorlandMonitor @stwater @EnvAgency @PeakChief @SheffieldGreens @ShefHallamLab @WarOnWildlife These are medieval practices happening in our @peakdistrict NP People visiting the @peakdistrict do not expect or support this destruction of wildlife. We need a #wilderfuture for our precious wildlife and for people.

üö©Abney Moor Hathersage üö© #peakdistrict  

‚ùå Stink Pit on a stream 

‚ùå Polluting @stwater supplies

urls.title: Cleaning Up with Michael Liebreich / Episode 31 - Emma Howard Boyd
urls.description: Emma Howard Boyd is one of the leading voices the UK‚Äôs Environment scene. As the Chair of the Environment Agency, she is at the forefront of the current environment agenda. This week, Michael and Emma will discuss everything from recent flooding in the UK to the unique UWC schooling experience.

tweets.text: In episode 31 of @MLCleaningUp, @MLiebreich invites @EmmaHowardBoyd, Chair of the @EnvAgency to discuss her role, recent floodings in the UK, and her how her @UWCint experience shapes the way she sees nature. Don't miss this episode at 6pm GMT tonight! https://t.co/K7G1zN24C5

tweets.text: The Natural Environment Investment Readiness Fund was launched yesterday. It provides grants for projects that enhance nature and help prepare for #climate shocks. It will also show others how green finance works. https://t.co/Vneka9lgLe #BuildBackGreener #TogetherForOurPlanet https://t.co/mK8by9AtbP

We are currently unsustainable in water. According to the Environment Agency, many water bodies do not have the flow to support the ecology. We are in a #water emergency.

https://t.co/b1p0SH0KEE

@BikeAndBoatUK @EnvAgency @RSPCA_official @TiggywinklesUK @BikeAndBoatUK Thanks for reporting this to us. Apologies for our delay in response. I've sent a message to the local teams so that they can look into the oil spill and get this cleaned up.

If you fancy working as a temporary lock-keeper on the The #Thames then please apply! Please note the email address should be Michelle.Boylan@brookstreet.co.uk for where to email your CV. https://t.co/GnwmBojUd1

Work has begun this week on #Kendal's ¬£76million #flood defences, over 5 years since #StormDesmond #flooded thousands of homes and #businesses here. The @EnvAgency says it needed time to get it right but some say it's still not right. I'll have more on @ITVBorder at 6pm. https://t.co/tXtj5WyEev

As I messed up the first tweet - Riparian Tree Fund - Day 2 - site complete with another 1920 whips in place, most infilling gaps, rest renovating existing hawthorn hedgerow. Only 4.4% tree cover in Blackpool, adding a hectare of woodland, a real bonus. @EnvAgencyNW @BpoolCouncil https://t.co/Q15agu4jJI https://t.co/wSuUvHgUkW

In episode 31 of @MLCleaningUp, @MLiebreich invites @EmmaHowardBoyd, Chair of the @EnvAgency to discuss her role, recent floodings in the UK, and her how her @UWCint experience shapes the way she sees nature. Don't miss this episode at 6pm GMT tonight! https://t.co/K7G1zN24C5

üö® NEW EPISODE ALERT üö®

LIVE NOW! @EmmaHowardBoyd, Chair of the @EnvAgency, joins @MLiebreich. Don't miss this episode with one of the leading voices in the UK‚Äôs Environment scene! 

Listen >> https://t.co/2EFmNbo67J
Watch >> https://t.co/JWKGT2GHaH https://t.co/6JrPw9EiKR

urls.title: Shocking state of English rivers revealed as all of them fail pollution tests
urls.description: Data reveals just 14% of good ecological standard and none of good chemical standard

tweets.text:
In 2020, 14% of UK rivers reached a good ecological standard and 100% of them failed to reach a good chemical standard. The report from @EnvAgency highlights clear room for improvement as more accurate testing is introduced. 

More: https://t.co/Vc5mQnNF4y

#marineconservation

Into last 2 weeks of @YorkshireiCASP communicating flood risk project. Interviewed 9 flood wardens, groups & community reps in Yorkshire so far to understand issues - but keen to reach more. email: sam.ramsden@hull.ac.uk 
@EnvAgencyYNE @Tod_Flood_Group https://t.co/KOHsVYKfJj

@EnvAgency @EnvAgencyNW Riparian Tree Fund planting kicked off today on the Fylde Coast. A case of spot the brook I am afraid, but there is one, I promise. ~120 large trees in place, ready for a lot of smaller whips tomorrow. Superb help from @BpoolCouncil tree gang and rangers. https://t.co/zDB9fjJ30N

Important meeting this evening for residents in #Preston #Broadgate #Avenham with ‚Å¶@EnvAgencyNW‚Å© on Flood Risk  Plans 
Good to see lots of residents in attendance. https://t.co/WJjAo0vqth

tweets.text: @TaraVallente @DrEdHenderson Hi Tara, this was reported to us yesterday. Our teams have looked into it and believe that this was caused by a landslide further upstream. The water should clear naturally in due course but we will see if we can work with landowners to plant trees in this area in the future.

urls.title: The government is looking the other way while Britain's rivers die before our eyes | George Monbiot
urls.description: Across the UK, once thriving waterways are being wiped out by farming and water companies, says Guardian columnist George Monbiot

tweets.text:
"The River Wye is dying at astonishing, heartbreaking speed."
Our rivers are our lifelines, the landscape's arteries. They're thickening, drying out & dying, due to pollution, incompetence & corruption.
@EnvAgency, @DefraGovUK: how can you let this happen?
https://t.co/312hITGd6t

@HerefordshireWT @EnvAgencyMids I suspect that not wholly successful winter wheat crop will be gleaned from the recently ploughed flood plain of the #RiverLugg I preferred the grazing wildflower meadows, but that‚Äôs just me I guess ü•¥ https://t.co/iCItQzrUob

Totalüí©that there has been no improvement to the sewage systems since the Victorian era   Combined Sewage Overflows are clearly operating all the time & even in light rainfallüí©or as the Water companies & @EnvAgency like to call them Storm drainsü§• https://t.co/7GxwnCj56z

urls.title: Simulating spatially coherent widespread flood events across the UK (Webinar) -
urls.description: UK Climate Resilience Programme Webinar Series 2021 24 February 2021 Speakers: Paul Sayers (Sayers and Partners); stakeholder response from Mike Steel Chair: Jason Lowe Register for the webinar Abstract CAT modelling was developed in the late 1980s to capture the spatial correlation of extreme events, with event footprints being used to demonstrate how an extreme [‚Ä¶]

tweets.text:
Webinar - Simulating spatially coherent widespread flood events across the UK

Join us for presentations by Paul Sayers (Sayers & Partners) and @DrMSteel (@EnvAgency). Chaired by Prof Jason Lowe (@MetOffice_Sci).

Wednesday 24 Feb, 12-1pm

Register: https://t.co/2Xvbfl6mHq https://t.co/GjvM40D2D9
